goal: Maximize CTR by inducing anticipation and resolving cognitive tension via the curiosity gap.
emotion_trigger: Curiosity, fear (danger), or shock/surprise; sadness correlates with high view counts.
creature_visibility: Partial reveal (silhouette, eyes, or blurred objects) to withhold the full story and create mystery.
scale_contrast: Juxtaposition of massive creatures against tiny subjects (human silhouettes, submarines, or ships) to hyperbolize scale.
subject_position: Focal point (eyes/subject) at Rule of Thirds intersections or centered; subject occupies 40%–50% of frame.
camera_framing: Tight crop or extreme close-up on faces/eyes to trigger social accountability and facial recognition priority.
lighting: High-contrast (minimum 4.5:1 ratio); use shadows or bright borders to separate subject from the abyss.
color_palette: Deep blues/blacks + neon accents (Cyan/Teal/Orange); use red for urgency; avoid "YouTube red" to prevent UI clashing.
background: High simplicity (empty abyss or blurred); maximum 3 elements total to prevent cognitive overload.
text_rule: Max 0–3 high-impact words (e.g., "The Truth", "Secrets"); bold sans-serif fonts (Impact, Montserrat, Anton).
text_placement: Upper-left or top-right quadrants; strictly avoid bottom-right "timestamp kill zone."
mobile_check: Yes; must be legible at 120p–150p width as ~70% of views are on mobile devices.
psychology: Information Gap Theory (cognitively induced deprivation), Amygdala response (fear), and N170 facial recognition.
avoid: Full creature reveal (kills mystery), clutter (>3 elements), low-resolution images, and muted contrast.
